001/**
002 * This controller creates a table to display the employee records.
003 * @author Aashikha Basappa
004 */
005package src.controller;
006import src.data.employee_data;
007import javafx.fxml.FXML;
008import javafx.scene.control.TableView;
009import javafx.scene.control.TableColumn;
010import javafx.scene.control.cell.PropertyValueFactory;
011import javafx.collections.FXCollections;
012import javafx.collections.ObservableList;
013import javafx.event.ActionEvent;
014
015import static src.controller.useful_functions.switch_scene;
016
017import src.model.employee;
018
019import src.database.db_connect;
020
021import java.sql.Connection;
022import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
023import java.sql.ResultSet;
024import java.sql.SQLException;
025
026/**
027 * Controller for the Employee Records page 
028 *      - It creates a table to display the employee records. 
029 *      - The table includes name, position, salary, and reporting manager. 
030 *      - Populates the table from the database. 
031 */
032public class employee_records_controller {
033    @FXML private TableView<employee> employeeTable;
034    /**
035     * Navigate back to the previous page
036     * @param event Trigger for the handler to be called
037    */
038    @FXML
039    private void handle_back_click(ActionEvent event) {
040        switch_scene("GUI/employee_data.fxml", event);
041    }
042    /**
043     * create columns in the chart
044    */
045    @FXML
046    public void initialize() {
047        // Build columns programmatically (like you create buttons for toppings)
048        if (employeeTable.getColumns().isEmpty()) {
049            TableColumn<employee, String> nameCol = new TableColumn<>("Name");
050            nameCol.setCellValueFactory(new PropertyValueFactory<>("employeeName"));
051            nameCol.setPrefWidth(160);
052
053            TableColumn<employee, String> positionCol = new TableColumn<>("Position");
054            positionCol.setCellValueFactory(new PropertyValueFactory<>("position"));
055            positionCol.setPrefWidth(160);
056
057            TableColumn<employee, Number> salaryCol = new TableColumn<>("Salary");
058            salaryCol.setCellValueFactory(new PropertyValueFactory<>("salary"));
059            salaryCol.setPrefWidth(170);
060
061            TableColumn<employee, String> reportingCol = new TableColumn<>("Reporting");
062            reportingCol.setCellValueFactory(new PropertyValueFactory<>("reporting"));
063            reportingCol.setPrefWidth(180);
064
065            employeeTable.getColumns().addAll(nameCol, positionCol, salaryCol, reportingCol);
066        }
067
068        employeeTable.setItems(FXCollections.observableArrayList(src.data.employee_data.getAll())
069);
070    }
071}
